alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Haralson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 9:41AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Haralson and central Carroll Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 940 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Waco, or 9 miles southwest of Buchanan, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Buchanan, Villa Rica, Bremen, Temple, Tallapoosa, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Waco, Bowdon Junction, Clem, Abilene, John Tanner State Park and Lowell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
